Package it.polimi.ingsw.Model

Class CharacterCardInput

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.Model.CharacterCardInput
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class CharacterCardInput extends Object implements Serializable
Each CharacterCard can use many input parameters. This class serves as a way to group all possible inputs and edit them in a safe, coherent way.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • CharacterCardInput

      public CharacterCardInput(PlayerBoard caller)
      Constructor for the base input of the card.
      Parameters:
      caller - each card requires the caller's PlayerBoard as an input.

  • Method Details

    • getCaller

      public PlayerBoard getCaller()
      Returns:
      the caller's PlayerBoard

    • getTargetIsland

      public OptionalValue<Island> getTargetIsland()
      Returns:
      the Island set as a target. The value is wrapped in a OptionalValue, as the related input is not compulsory

    • setTargetIsland

      public void setTargetIsland(Island targetIsland)
      Parameters:
      targetIsland - the Island to set as a target

    • getTargetPawn

      public OptionalValue<PawnColour> getTargetPawn()
      Returns:
      the PawnColour set as a target. The value is wrapped in a OptionalValue, as the related input is not compulsory

    • setTargetPawn

      public void setTargetPawn(PawnColour targetPawn)
      Parameters:
      targetPawn - the PawnColour to set as a target

    • getTargetPawnPairs

      public OptionalValue<List<Pair<PawnColour,PawnColour>>> getTargetPawnPairs()
      Returns:
      the the List of Pairs of PawnColour set as a target. The value is wrapped in a OptionalValue, as the related input is not compulsory

    • setTargetPawnPairs

      public void setTargetPawnPairs(List<Pair<PawnColour,PawnColour>> targetPawnPairs)
      Note: the convention of the Pair is to be verified through the card that requires the input.
      Parameters:
      targetPawnPairs - the List of Pairs of PawnColour to set as a target.
